Although the restaurant is near to our house, it took my wife and I almost two years before trying it. Our only regret is that it took way to long to try it! We've recently been to Portugal, and I never liked cod while in Brazil, but my wife loves it. She convinced me to try it there,  and the taste was really different from what we usually have here in Brazil. Well, I am glad to inform cod fans that Lisboa restaurant brings authentic Portuguese cousine: we had cod cake for starters. Light, well cooked and reasonable size. My wife ordered a traditional cod with cream, served on clay pot. Its preparation includes golden onions in olive oil, white sauce, fresh cream, thin slices of pre fried potatoes and Grana Padano cheese. I had to surrender to the temptation of trying it, after my wife's comments about it. The dish is very well served - we ordered half portion - and perfectly cooked. To make a long story short: delicious! I ordered salmon on champagne sauce, served with gratin potato and flamb√© palm heart. Also well served, and great experience. We had a Cava Don Roman Demi-sec, and the waiter promptly told us that in future meals we could bring our own wine/sparkling wine, free of charge - limited to one bottle per person. Not a problem for us, we barely handle one bottle during a meal. For desert my wife had a pastel of Bel√©m and I had a Petit Gateau. Add to this quality meal a discrete and efficient service, and a cost atmosphere: all my n all, a perfect dinner. The price was fair - around US$ 100. It would have been around US$ 75 if we had brought our own wine. We are looking forward for our next visit, to try different dishes!

Outstanding food and service but I don‚Äôt like the way they do business. They did to me what I call a bait and switch .  
 I have been looking forward to eating at at this restaurant for a while. When I got an email coupon today for fish and chips and I might add that I love fish I was excited to try it ! 
 I made the reservation I also asked them if I understood the offer correctly and that is that it came with either a soup or a salad. The person on the phone confirmed that it did. 
 Before I began to order with our lovely waitress  I asked if I could substitute the french fries for anything else and she said yes any side on the menu .  I said any of them will substitute and she said yes. So I picked the asparagus or macaroni and cheese depending on what she would let me have. She said they‚Äôll be no charge for the asparagus but there will be a $3.50 up charge for the mac & cheese. I said that‚Äôs fine. So that was the end of the order. About five minutes later she came out and said I made a mistake there is going to be $5.50 charge for the mac & cheese. I said that‚Äôs fine I‚Äôll still take it. But in my mind I‚Äôm thinking about my own business selling trees and bushes and if I misquote I stay with my original price quoted.  This is what I think a high-end restaurant should also do. The meal was great and I enjoyed every bite. At the end of the meal  I got the bill. I noticed that there was a $9.50 charge for the soup. When I questioned her about it she said oh I had no idea that the soup was included. Granted I had called to check with whoever answers the phone but the waitress did not know. So she left and came back and said you have a choice I will either give you a free salad or a free dessert or I will take off the $5.50 mac & cheese. I did not want to be argumentative but the right thing to do was to take off the soup since soup was free with the meal. So for $4 I cannot give a good review.   It was wrong. For four dollars they earned a bad reputation in my book for being a bait and switch company. I gave this restaurant three stars because of that. That‚Äôs what I call a bait and switch. You promise one thing and then deliver something different.  Do what you say and you say what you do Devon‚Äôs!  If you have free soup with your Fish special and you make a mistake and charge $9.50 then you take off $9.50, not $5.50
.

My daughter had some kind of pacific punch drink that she couldn‚Äôt finish. I drank the remaining part of it as well and it was spectacular. I highly recommend going between 4 and 6:30pm for their happy hour appetizers and cocktails.

I have been to a number of fine dining restaurants over the years and many seem to have flavors but OX Steakhouse is so unique from the staff to the food everything here has been considered and crafted to the smallest detail, reminds me so much of Las Vegas and their glamour lights. 
The menu does much more than inform guests about what they offer It helps to create and communicate their food identity and influences not to mention the "fire bar" my guess the house DNA, OMG the drinks were beyond imagination, I was told that the bartender has won numerous competitions, what a night! 
I don't know if giving a five-star is totally appropriate, for me to rate it with stars somehow seems to cheapen the level of artistry which goes into the cocktails, meals and the wonderful presentation this Steakhouse has to offer.
This is a place I will fondly remember from my trip to Brazil, no question about it. Well worth the money, good value too for the quality of their tasting menu. Can't say enough about how good it was!!!!!  it was amazing.    
I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a dinner venue for a special occasion or simply enjoy life with family and friends, and I will be back the next chance I can. Thank's, Curitiba! Thank's, OX!!!

We chose this hotel because it is fairly new and has a contemporary look to the decor compared to other hotels in Curitiba, many of which have dark wood in abundance.

The hotel has a nice bar area and is open from 10 till 10, so don't expect late night drinks. Good selection of spirits, if a little expensive.
The bedrooms are spacious and nicely furnished, with good mix of lighting (desk, bedside, overhead, floor standing) so created a relaxing environment.
We only had breakfast in the restaurant which was fine. Nothing amazing but nothing to complain about. If you want omelettes, eggs done a certain way, etc., you need to ask for this.
I also found it cheaper to pay for breakfast at the hotel rather than as part of the package through a travel site.
The hotel is fairly centrally located with a shopping centre (and food court) nearby.
If I was visiting Curitiba again, I would definitely stay there as it suited my European tastes and travel experience.

My stay here was first class. A fairly new hotel, the room and bathroom were large, modern, functional and very clean. The bed and pillows were comfortable and the black out curtains all helped ensure a great nights sleep. The WiFi was good throughout the hotel and they have charging points at a number of the tables in the restaurant - a great idea. Good number of PowerPoints in the room. The restaurant specialises in Peruvian food. The lunch buffet was excellent and dinner was always good, not just because of the food, but a great selection of wines as well. The bar has a great selection of beers, and beer on tap - fantastic, and something I can't recall seeing in a hotel bar previously. The location is great - central and an easy walk to the city centre and a lot of attractions. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, especially with my poor Portuguese. The laundry service they use lost my laundry. They eventually found it and as I had already left Curitiba, the hotel boxed it up and had it at my hotel in Rio De Janeiro the next day. For that, I'm incredibly thankful, and after some anxiety, it just added to, and highlighted the quality of service I received the entire time I was there. Highly recommended!

This is our first visit to Brazil, and our second time to stay at Novotel.
One of the reasons we chose this hotel was the parking garage. We have a car with US plates, and in other countries have been cautioned not to park on the street.
This area is quite tranquil and the car would likely have been just fine, but we slept much more soundly having paid the 24R ($6 us) to have it securely in a guarded garage.
When we arrived, we were greeted with a warm smile by Andres who spoke fluent Spanish and English, and welcomed us, providing explanations, details and answering our many questions.
We dinedible in the hotel restaurant, which specializes in Peruvian food. I must say, having lived in Peru for 11 months, Peruvian food is amazing, and not easy to duplicate outside of Peru this place has better Peruvian food than several places in Peru.
The room was comfortable and clean, and cute. One neat feature was the USB plug near the bed that saved us since we did not yet have the adapter to plug our US plugs into the Brazilian outlets.
The breakfast buffet was outstanding with a huge variety of breads and pastries which was a big win with my kids, and fruit and yogurt which delighted my husband, and sliced meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs and warm meats which brought me joy. Lots of other options which I am not going to list, but certainly no skimping.
The cherry on top was Ailton taking the time to give us an impromptu Portuguese lesson, as well as sharing details about Floridanopolis, Isla Campeche, and other points along the way for us to explore. He really went above and beyond to help us have the best experience in Curitiba and beyond.
On our return, several days later, Washington welcomed us, and in perfect English checked us in and helpedme to find my phone  (spoiler: it was in my husband's pocket)
I cannot recommend this place enough: excellent location, amazing service, genuinely welcoming people, great value.

Location, location, location. Everything in Brazil is about location. You need to be within walking distance or at least a short Uber right away from where you want to visit and the Novotel Curitiba Batel is right in the heart of everything.
I can't review the rooms since we managed to score one of the two suites for the weekend, but what I can say is the suites are huge, modern, and worth the extra money if you aren't using your points. The super king bed is glorious, the sheets are soft and clean, and each of the two rooms (living and bedroom) has a giant television. There's plenty of space to sprawl out and set up all your computer equipment with ample outlets everywhere. Be aware that Curitiba is 220v so make sure your equipment is bi-volt.
Breakfast is well above average with plenty of foods to choose from, all well prepared and laid out.
The suites have two separate bathrooms, the smaller of the two only having a sink and toilet whereas the larger has a toilet, shower, large sink and the real kicker which is the double-jacuzzi. Yowza! That alone made the trip worthwhile. I've been all over Brazil and stayed in hotels too numerous to mention and so far the Novotel Curitiba Batel takes the cake with the double-jacuzzi in the suite. It's nothing short of glorious. That alone makes the room worth it.

Another Brazilian deception...not to call it robbery. The only 5 stars feature Nomaa Hotel has is the tag price; the most expensive in Curitiba by the way. The closet is a master piece in ridiculous design: huge shelves but no room to hang a longer garment ( my wife was pissed she couldn‚Äôt hand her close). And the entire closet for the clothes is a foot, by one and a half, by four tall but you do get your pretentious Nespresso machine. The rest of the room is pretty depressing, e.g. white plaster wall, no art, etc.
We did ask to talk with manager: at lunch now, on a trip, busy in a meeting...until the cleaning lady told us there is no manager during the weekend.
To solve the problem we were offered a connecting room...at a 20 percent discount! Same problem, closet et all. They also said if we didn‚Äôt like it, we had the option to leave. 
It would be ok if this hotel was at the most a three stars, but five stars and the most expensive in Curitiba?! Poor place, awful service and very expensive!!!
